snippet: A new sale of American International Group stock is the government’s latest move to disentangle itself from one of the most significant bailouts it made in the 2008 financial crisis.
abstract: A new sale of American International Group stock is the government’s latest move to disentangle itself from one of the most significant bailouts it made in the 2008 financial crisis.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

headline.main: Treasury to Cut A.I.G. Stake Below 50%
headline.print_headline: Treasury To Reduce A.I.G. Stake Below 50%
